settings.name: Upper speed bound for 'stationary' behaviour (km/h)
settings.description: Insert the upper speed cutoff for behaviour to be classified as 'stationary'.

settings.name: Altitude change threshold (metres):
settings.description: The absolute change in altitude between consecutive locations beyond which a bird is considered as ascending/descending. For example, setting this to 25 means that the bird is ascending when its change in altitude exceeds 25m, and descending when it falls below -25m. This setting is used only if column `altitude` is present in the input data.

settings.name: Sunrise leeway (minutes)
settings.description: Defines the number of minutes before/after **sunrise** marking the start of the 'daytime' period. Negative values (e.g. -5 minutes) move this window before sunrise, while positive numbers indicate a shift after. Used to determine the potential end of the roosting period.

settings.name: Sunset leeway (minutes)
settings.description: Defines the number of minutes before/after **sunset** marking the start of the 'night-time' period. Negative numbers move this window before sunset; positive numbers move it after. Used to define the potential start of the roosting period. Stationary behaviour after this time, and before the next determined *daytime*, is considered as roosting.

settings.name: Create summary plots
settings.description: Select this option to generate, as artefacts, bird-specific graphs with: (i) location plots of behaviourally-classified movements; and (ii) diagnostic plots for the stationary-speed given hours-since-sunrise model.

settings.name: Keep all generated columns
settings.description: Select this option to keep all columns created during the classification process. Recommend for debugging purposes only.
